description:
Not a bad dive bar to get a drink with some friends and play some pool. They only have one pool table bc this place is small so get that table early if you want it. 

They have a good amount of tvs here and show the fights on fight night! 

Capacity I would say is 150 and it's located on a great spot on Polk. 

There are food spots in the area bc they don't have food here which I wish they would. 

David has always been the bartender when I've been there. He is a great mixologist. Great conversation and gets good tips well deserved. He can definitely handle the bar alone.... busy or not.
author: Angel M.

description:
This polk street staple has been serving libations to sports fans for as long as I've lived in San Francisco. My experience every time is consistently ok, with the staff generally being the least impressive part. Everyone is a bit salty but, they have plenty of screens so it makes for a fun viewing experience. 

The buckets of domestic beer are around 25 bucks for 5 beers, which is a solid deal by city standards. We ordered a few rounds of those, brought in some pizza from down the street and had a fun evening. 

It's a good little sports bar but, given the options in sf, it sits in the middle of the pack.
author: Benjamin F.

description:
This review is solely based on the women's restroom. I went there before ordering a beer and was appalled to find that the toilet seat was smaller than the bowl(!) 
Maybe it's unfair to judge a bar on the state of its toilet but if you don't think highly enough of your female patrons to buy a $15 adequately-sized toilet seat, I don't want to know how your beer service is.
author: Dyanna Q.

description:
Well, besides having access to several screens showing me all the baseball that I want, decently priced HH beer prices, good music there is not much else to want for a sports bar. But there is a main component-the bartender. Green's has a couple of excellent bartenders and one who is not so much. What makes the bartender with a ponytail good-knows his sports and fills your beer when desired. The "not so much" guy doesn't track your beer, spends time yakkin to friends on the street and needs to be asked to put on a game.
Otherwise, love the sport memorabilia and vibe of Green's.  I'll keep coming back.
author: Derald C.

description:
I love no-frills bars, and Greens hit a home run (woo sports) with me when my boyfriend and I stopped in to watch the Eagles v. Giants game. There was a group of Eagles fans (MY PEOPLE HELLO) under one of the larger screens and enough space for us, so we asked to join. The group was friendly, and we had a great time chatting about the Birds and Philly. The drink specials are decent (Blue Moon and Coors Light) and there are waitresses that circulate the room to bring around drinks - which they manage to do really quickly! It was great seeing fans of a bunch of teams and seeing all of the memorabilia scattered throughout the bar. I'll definitely be back for some game watches! 

Greens doesn't serve food, but you're allowed to bring your own. Consider grabbing something to eat from one of the many great places on Polk!
author: Sarah B.

description: Best bar in SF to watch a game. True San Franciscan bar, best bartenders in town and willing to change a game around for you on the screens. Woo!
author: Nick C.

description:
Even though I once got broken up with here, it's a solid sports bars. Greens was the first bar I ever went to in the neighborhood and I've been coming back ever since. It's a great place to watch any game and you're sure to have great company. Friendly staff, great beer selection and lots of tvs. 

They don't serve food, but you can bring anything in. You can literally get a pizza delivered to your bar stool. Win. 

I watched the Giants win the Worlds Series here and wouldn't have wanted to watch it anywhere else!
author: Lacey L.

description: This probably one of the most unexpected places to find everything that you need for a night out to watch a game. I met some friends here on a Saturday night to finish watching the UCLA and Boulder game, it was pretty cool how our group got to have our own space to enjoy the game and bar itself. There is a minimum on credit cards, but that goes pretty fast when you have a group of people. Plenty of TVs with all different sports and games playing, its really nice because you never know when you want to have the updated score for another nail-biter game! Also, thought it was pretty cool that they all all different types of memorabilia on the walls and lots of different celebrities with cool artifacts. Definitely not your typical hole-in-the-wall sports bar.  Definitely will be back!!
author: Micah L.

description:
This is a great spot on Polk street. Good selection of beers (about $6 each) and huge windows open on a nice day. This is a perfect game day spot. Literally anywhere in the bar where you sit there is a TV in view.
Friendly service, $20 min on credit cards, casual vibe. Oh, and you can bring in your own food
Cheers greens
author: Kelsey B.

description: They wouldn't let my brother in because he had a tribal ID. Every other bar and liquor store were ok with me using my tribal ID but the guy said he couldn't recognize it. Even though it is a federal ID and said Wisconsin on it and showed his birthdate. The guy was being a prick.
author: Lionel S.

description: Jason the door man , very inviting, if you need to know San Fran. Info these guys will give you the time of day!!
author: Heidi M.

description: their ADA elevator for wheelchair users was blocked on both sides by tables and being used as a coat rack for patrons, which meant anyone in a wheelchair couldn't access the bathroom at all. when asked, the bartender told me it was "broken," tho no signs marked it as such. apparently the ADA and accessibility for disabled patrons isn't remotely important to this bar. if you're disabled, know somebody disabled, or just give a f about disability rights, i suggest you don't give this bar your money.
author: Heather R.

description: Good sports bar. Lots of tv's. Cash preferred, $20 minimum required for card.  Bathrooms could also be cleaner.
author: Serge P.

description: We were here with a group of about ten people for our two friends birthday parties. The bartender feigned mininal interest in serving us. At 1:10, it was just our group and the bartender gave us all sorts of attitude. After asking the bartender if we should leave, he nonchalantly indicated which direction the door was. After clearly feeling unwelcome and collectively spending ~ $300, we left at about 1:15, after which the bartender closed the gates out front. The bar states it closes at 2am, clearly this isn't the case. We won't be returning and your music sucks.
author: Alejandro R.

description: So, I went searching through San Francisco for a dive bar, and happened across this place.  I suspect this would be a great place during football season, with lots of space, lots of tvs, and lots of memorabilia.  Unfortunately, without the lure of football, Green's was so-so.  While there was a collection of items and old pennants, many of them were so dated, they looked quite grungy.  Tap selection was fair.  I wouldn't hesitate to go back, but of the places I went to on Polk Street, this was just a solid ok.
author: Jeff M.

description: Good place to watch a sports game on polk. If your football team loses you can cheer on your baseball team right after and hopefully they win!  Faced with so many decisions it might be a no brainer for some.
author: Antigone S.

description: Went to have a drink, most bars here are closed, saw this one open, wanted to make sure so we asked who was apparently the owner. He ignored us when we asked 2 times. The 3rd time we asked and he said yes in an annoyed manner then shook his head. Been to this bat before and the atmosphere is good but I don't support bad owners. Off to another bar.
author: Jigga A.

description:
This bar has been my NFL game day home for 4 years now. I am proud to say it has become the best Carolina Panthers Bar in San Francisco!  We always have a big group of regulars and the atmosphere couldn't be better. Plenty of TVs with all the rest of the games on as well. 

Aside from being the best Panthers bar, they have consistent staff who are friendly and treat the customers so well. Everyone in the bar knows Shannon who has been serving us the whole time. I couldn't substitute another bar for Green's as this is now my Sunday home!
author: Ryan R.

description: Excellent and accommodating service. Small-town feel with great beer selection. 10/10 would recommend.
author: Jordan G.

description: came here for March madness and despite the fact that it was busy af I had great service from Kevin and Rich. Love this place.
author: Erin W.

description: One of the bartenders here is a total asshole. I paid my tab (and received my credit card from behind the bar) and he then told my friend after me I hadn't paid and double charged him for my bill. I had already left so only found out afterwards. Screw this place.
author: Nathan C.

description: The worst bar I've ever attended twice. A*shole bartenders who got pissy for trying to get a drink. If you're a sports fan looking for the game, go to Pete's Tavern. Worth the travel.
author: Chris B.

description: This bar is pretty cool at night, fun atmosphere had good nights there.........then I met the owner. What a piece of shit. Asked the guy a simple question and got no response, asked it again, same thing. I figured he didn't understand simple English. Nope he's just a complete cock face. Can't bring myself to spend $ in a place where the owner is completely disrespectful to his customers. Probably why it's empty until nighttime.
author: Nick L.

description:
Favorite bar to watch football at. It gets pretty
Packed on Sunday's, but no matter how busy the service is great! There are tons of tv so every game is always on. They don't serve food but you can bring any food you want in.
author: Lilly B.

description:
Great, fun sports bar, open air feeling. The bartenders are very witty, and fun with a great group of regulars.

 But beware, the cocktails are stiff.
author: Barbi T.

description:
A great neighborhood bar, with friendly servers and bartenders, packed with TVs, and great places to watch NFL games, particularly if you're a Carolina Panthers fan! Always great to meet other transplants from Charlotte and the Carolinas up in the back section.

Prices are good and Blue Barn is right next door to pick up a delicious sandwich or two
author: Lucas S.

description:
If I'm on Polk and itching for a game, chances are I'm watching here at Green's. It's not glamorous or the finest sports bar by any means, but the fact they throw in game audio and host a hell of a crowd make for an interesting, yet divey ambiance. Bonus points for having reasonably priced drinks and a fun tap selection.

A sports bar is no bar without a decent slew of TVs, which I'm happy to report Greens has plenty of. There is no shortage of sports memorabilia, most of which are found in photo frames caked throughout the walls. How none of the images are soaked in beer is beyond me.

The bartenders are usually a jolly ol bunch, so as long as you can get to the bar. When there are bar crawls (I can *only* imagine how insane St. Patty's Day is), the place basically has arms and legs hanging out of the windows. If you're claustrophobic in any way, Greens might not be the place for you.

Last I checked the place doesn't serve food, which is a bummer for you kids lookin for wings and calorically rich bar food. That's not why the star rating is minus -1, it's because I nearly lost my lunch walking in their bathrooms. Next time I want to reenact a scene from the Walking Dead (complete with smell), I'll be sure to walk in there.
author: Jando S.

description:
If I lived in Russian Hill I'd be a frequent visitor through the NBA season (aka 7 months a year). 

Several TVs and the bartenders are extremely accommodating to your game of choice.
author: Linda X.

description: If you like booze & sports don't waste you're time going anywhere else. #SundayTicket
author: Sean V.

description: Great spot for game day. Except for in the back by the pool table, every area has great views of multiple TVs. Decent selection of beers on tap, but nothing exotic or rare. Alas, no food.
author: Nick M.

description: Great place to watch games. Cheap drinks, and always open tables with plenty of TVs.
author: Michelle L.

description: Cool joint. I've gone twice now. First time was crowded but not too bad. Second time was nearly empty which was fine for our group of 7! Plenty of seating. The bartender was nice and there's plenty of TVs!
author: Lesina G.

description:
This place is fun and lively and a home of most if not all MSU fans.
I wish they serve food though but you can bring in  food from outside. Drinks are cheap and bartenders are attentive and fast.
I would definitely have to come back here for another fun game night. Come early as this place gets packed. Reserve a table for all your friends.
author: Claudine V.

description:
Best Carolina Panthers bar in town! I was in town during the playoff game and wanted to watch with fellow Panthers fans and I was not disappointed. A great group of people and a fun bar.  

Bloody Mary's are spicy like I prefer them and they have great beer specials.
author: Amy O.

description:
This place gets a 4 star... The bartender however on 7/18/15 gets a 2 star.  We were in the middle of a 'pub crawl bday thing' and i ordered 2 'car bombs' which usually pisses off bartenders for whatever reason this guy just acts like a jerk , reluctantly makes drinks and poured 2 other vodka sodas when i only asked for 1. Not to put him in an all out rage i paid and left. Fuck polk street bars, dont know why i gave them
A second chance
author: Andy H.

description:
$3 beers or happy hour and fast service despite the fact that there's only one bartender.  $18 for a bucket of beer. 

You're allowed to bring food in because they don't sell food there.  There's pizza / bagels / burgers / burritos on the same block, so you won't go hungry!

There are TVs everywhere so your view won't be blocked.  It helps that there's an elevated part in the back if you're short like me (:

I think this may be the only bar like on Polk... but I'd probably only come here to watch a game.
author: Jennifer L.

description: One of the best sports bars in SF. Can get a little bro-y depending on what teams are playing. Lots of tvs, good staff, and delicious pizza just down the block that you can bring with.
author: Robbie K.

description:
With our table at Gioia pizza a 40 minute estimate away, we headed across the street for a pre-dinner drink. They have a pretty good selection of draft beers (my definition being there are at least some I have not heard of) but being the creature of habit that I am, I ordered a hef. It was delicious as always.

Service was good and prices were reasonable ($4 each)

HOT TIP: Guys, do not bring your date here. She will notice that you are looking directly over her head at the TV behind her.
author: Rachel E.

description:
I was with a few girls at around 5 pm and we tried to close the front windows as we were sitting up front and Jason, the doorman wouldn't let us. 

I asked why as they were so cold and he said "because I said so". I then suggested to him that we pay to be here (for a birthday party) and he laughed in my face and said that I also pay to be a jackass....

I don't understand why he was this way, but with some people it isn't worth it...

Needless to say it was a terrible experience from an otherwise great bar....
author: Mike F.

description: No food, crummy attitude - totally arrogant bartender/owner.  My bill didn't even have an details. Won't be back. Have loved San Fran so far, but not Green's.
author: Jim H.

description: Great bartenders, great drinks and great place to watch some football. This bar is the best place in SF to watch the Carolina Panthers hands down. You are guaranteed to meet some fun people from Carolina which is always good in my book!
author: Britney T.

description: Love watching the Carolina Panthers at Greens. Lots of TV, friendly service, and great selection of beers
author: Evan T.

description: Best place for football. No matter where you sit you will be in front of a game.. Lots of Nfl fans so you will find someone to connect with. $15 buckets of beer and you can bring food in .. Go eagles..And if your lucky enough to get Nicole waiting on you then you are in for the best service
author: Eric R.

description: Good cheap beer. They played the Dodgers on the TV and the Steelers game. So overall pretty good.  Bad part is they don't serve food.
author: Manda S.

description: Great place to hang out for sports, especially for football.  Lots of TVs, you won't miss a thing.
author: Wayne W.

description:
They showed the 49ers-Seahawks game where the 49ers lost last Sunday.  Not sure I'll ever come back because of the bad memories.


Otherwise a really cool bar.
author: Scott H.

description:
Best Carolina Panthers bar in town!  I come to the games every single week and the back TV area is always rowdy with people from the great state of NC.  Our favorite local waitress, Shannon, provides amazing service and sets us up with shots after a Panther win.

If anybody recently moved here from NC or is just an avid Panthers fan, I would strongly recommend checking this place out on Sundays.

#KeepPounding
author: Parker P.

description:
This is a sports bar galore. I first started coming here because I have a friend who is obsessed with the Packers. During a game, this places is packed. Come early in order to get a seat.

The great thing about this place is that on most nights they have some type of $2/$3 beer special. 

Its a typical sports bar- not much else to say. Great convenient location with many other bars around if youre hopping around.
author: Viktoriya Z.

description:
Pretty cool place.  Being from Wisconsin I am a huge Packer Fan, and I was happy to see that it is indeed a Packer Bar on Sundays!  The unfortunate thing is that I have Direc TV Sunday Ticket and haven't been there for a Packer game, but they get my vote for a cool bar. 

I have had a few adult beverages there and they were fine.  A lot of pub crawlers and college age in attendance, which is fine for entertainment purposes.  They have a lot of TVs and a pool table.  The bar is average and the bartenders are cool.  My favorite part is the pseudo outside space when you walk in.
author: Jeremy E.

description:
Came here yesterday with some friends to watch the Oregon Duck game! Only 3 dollar beers and its a great atmosphere with tons of TV's so you don't have to worry about your game not being on! :) Everyone was really nice and friendly. 

You can bring in food from outside because they don't serve food here. That was kind of a drag but other than that I would definitely recommend this place! :)
author: Katie D.

description: Came by with a few friends a while back. This bar is nice and spacious. It was funny to walk up and see the bouncer reading a giant novel - Stephen King =). We hung out at tables in the back and it actually got more and more crowded towards the end of the night but it's a chill place to grab a few drinks (this is on a non-game night).
author: Ziyan C.

description: Went there quite early on a weekday afternoon, so not many people in the bar. I was with a friend from NYC, but the bartender wouldn't accept his NYC id, supposedly because "he had been to NYC and had never seen that before". Whatever, a different ID got him his beer but that sounded quite rude. All in all we did not feel particularly welcome so we drank it and made our way to another bar on Polk st.
author: Benoît D.

description: It's your typical sports bar. TVs everywhere. Loots of sports memorabilia on the walls. I popped in last night to catch the Heat/Spurs game and was surprised that this place doesn't serve any food. It was built without a kitchen. All you get is beer and liquor. I suppose you can't go wrong there. Go for sports but if you're looking to get in the mix of things there are a few others spots on Polk Street to consider.
author: Xerxes N.

description:
Green's reminds me of watching sports in my father's garage as a kid, which was essentially a "man cave" before the term was popularized by Maxim Magazine and ubiquitous American light beer commercials. You won't find a single square inch of naked, exposed timber anywhere in the joint outside of the hard wood floors that isn't draped with team memorabilia, newspaper clippings highlighting monumental feats of male dominance, or framed Sports Illustrated covers that were considered quite racy for the era. But now, with images of Tommy Lee captaining a skiff while still having both hands free or the vomit-inducing flashbacks to Two Girls, One Cup... those SI shoots are about as tame as a spread in Woman's World Magazine.

Outside of the old school, worn in feel of Green's, it's always a solid choice for watching any sporting event along Polk if you can handle the Marina-esqe Russian Hill crowd. Plenty of HD TVs dotting the interior, cheap beer specials, and they'll even let you bring in your own food if you feel like having a bite while rooting on your favorite team. Pretty standard for bars that don't serve food of their own, but still, it's worth noting.
author: Ruggy J.

description: The bartender told my friends to get up and move from the table but would not give a reason. Confused but compliant, they started gathering their things. Apparently it was not fast enough and the bartender took it upon himself to physically move the table with their drinks still on it. He gave the table to two girls who had just walked in. There was no reservation for the table. My friends had been seated there for over an hour. My friends were simply trying to watch game 7 of the World Series. This was the final straw after hearing all the rumors of questionable behaviors of the employees and management.
author: Taylor R.

description:
My friends and I came into the bar during the early evening so naturally there were few people on a typical cold and windy SF evening. Our group was cold at our table so we tried to close a window... Minutes later the doorman, Jason, aggressively  approached us and yelled to keep the windows open.  We asked the rationale for not being able to open them and his response? "Because I said so". 

We asked our waitress as well who also referred us to ask the doorman- moments later our waitress and the doorman were laughing together glaring in our direction! Jason was texting on his phone during his entire shift, paying little attention to guests freely entering the bar. However, when a friend and I left the bar to pick up sandwiches and returned 5 minutes later, we were greeted with, "I don't recognize your faces, IDs to enter". My boyfriend also asked Jason again separately why paying customers couldn't close the windows and his response? That we wouldn't be able to close the windows "because he said so" and even called him, I quote, "you pay to be a jackass". Becoming unbearable, we wanted to leave but we couldn't since the group was gathering for a birthday. I asked Jason again, kindly, if it would be possible to close the windows. I was talked down to and threaten to be kicked out of the bar! 

I'm not one to write yelp reviews but I highly discourage anyone from spending time or money at this bar. My friends and I were extremely uncomfortable in this aggressive hostile environment, and appalled that customers giving the bar business would be treated with such unprofessional disrespect. I've work in the service industry many years, and this is clearly unacceptable employee behavior. It's also clear to me that management is not concerned with their guests experience because I can't imagine justifying Jason's employment.
author: Electra K.

description:
There it is again! I'm giving out 4 star reviews like it's no big deal! (And trust me, I'm not usually so generous.) I can't specifically pin-point what I like about this place- but I do! I really do!

The Greens Sports Bar makes me feel like I'm not in San Francisco- I could be in Boston, Austin, Charleston- whatever- and yet, I'm absolutely San Franciscan all at the same time. I'm not quite sure how to describe this feeling- but I think it might resemble love.

A girlfriend and I decided to do some bar-hopping and stopped by for a drink. The crowd, while totally blitzed (which is to be expected after a 49ers win) was amazing. Super friendly, down-to-earth, just havin' a good time people. I loved every minute of it and everyone I talked to! (Minus that one guy...)

The bartender was super friendly, and gave us a free glass of wine. (Someone had mis-ordered and he figured it best not go to waste!) The multi-levels are really neat- traditional bar area below, lots of stools, tables, and tvs above. Love it!

Baseball season is just around the corner- and you can bet where I"ll be! :)

NOTE: The Final Final is STILL my favorite for Husker games!
author: Annalise F.

description: This is my go to NFL bar but they usually have any reasonable game on. Also a good place to get a final for the night.
author: Beau H.

description:
This place is a sports fan's wet dream. It shows all the games and has great drink specials. I am a HUGE GB Packers fan and it's nice to go somewhere where I can watch the games. That was the positive part of the bar.

Some of the guys that go there are terribly rude. I had a Baltimore Ravens fan (he was a chubby white gentlemen) literally tell me to my face "I want to punch you wearing that damn jersey" (I was wearing my #52 Clay Matthews jersey). I was shocked. Thank goodness my boyfriend was there and told the guy to leave. He was a drunken mess. And I think he is a regular because as he was leaving he turned around and said "fuck you" to me and the bartender laughed it off. I'm sorry but on what planet is it ok to speak to a female that way? The same guy also bumped into a different girl and threw a drink on her. And that STILL wasn't enough to kick him out. When I complained to the bartender, he laughed at me and walked away! That is NOT ok. You should make sure your female customers feel safe from jerks like that!

After the incident, I told my boyfriend I wanted to leave immediately. We got our bill and we were over charged $83. I requested to see the break down of the charges and I wasn't given it! They just ran my card. I was so appalled we left. How can we have an almost $100 dollar tab when the beers are $3 a piece and we had 7 between the 2 of us?

All in all, I am so disappointed with the lack of action from the bartenders and so-called security and disorganization of the servers. I will not be going back. Too bad.....
author: Judie R.

description:
I love sports bars.I can watch a game in any environment and this place is ideal. Went for the Euro 2012 final game and had a BLAST!!

So aside from Spain winning, which was great, the bartenders worked quickly to get the drinks poured. A big crowd and only two guys but they kicked butt!

Important sport note: Multiple tvs!
 
I'm def going to put this bar in my NFL Sunday rotation. Esp since there were some cute guys here, too.
author: Jay H.

description: Great place to watch the World Cup!  Casual atmosphere, loads of tvs to watch whatever sporting event is on and a good location. Bathrooms have always been clean, which is nice!  Bartenders are usually alright, but one guy was semi-rude to us about a soda water and a disgusting beer we ordered. We'll just avoid him from now on, since he seems to like to argue!
author: Sheena C.

description:
The moment we walked in it just smelled like a ton of marijuana. I don't know why, but I basically thought this bar was hot boxed. And if I am not starring in Pineapple Express or something like that, then I don't really need the bar I am at smelling like it ha

And for some reason I just didn't really like being in this bar. It wasn't very packed at all, probably because this bar just wasn't exciting. It is a sports bar, but I've been to plenty that are fun to be inside of and I just wasn't feeling this place at all. 

There are lots of tables and chairs and based on how empty it was, it would make a good meeting or stopping point maybe where you can drink for cheap, but other than that, I don't know why I would come back to this bar when there are so many other better bars on this same street!
author: Sarah G.

description:
Greens is a pretty standard sports bar on Polk but despite my love of both sports and drinking I don't think I've ever purposefully come here to watch a game.  The place always seems to be either insanely crowded when there's an event going on or empty almost to the point of being awkward when there's not.  I agree with the previous reviewer who says you can never get here early enough -- hence why I haven't ever made it here for a game.

The place is pretty spacious which is refreshing compared to a lot of the other places on Polk that seem barely wider than my apartment hallway (cough cough Buccaneer cough Bullitt cough cough).  The spaciousness goes out the window when a game is on though; people are spilling from the front window like out a can of sardines.  

The crowd seems slightly less yuppie douche (but on the flip side, perhaps more greasy) than some of the other places nearby.  The selection of beers on tap is good, but annoyingly they don't sell by the pitcher.   Pretty reasonably priced in my experience, and they have good specials as well.  I've been pretty pleased with this place but given how popular it is I would recommend skipping it if you actually want to pay attention during the big game.
author: Molly B.

description:
My gf and I stopped by here before dinner to buy me a drink. 

It wasn't too busy even for a Sunday. Although football season was already over and it happened to be Valentine's Day.

There only looked to be 1 bartender working, but the size of the crowd he had at the time looked to be justifiable to have no other help.

Now everyone has already mentioned there are so many TVs here. That is definitely true. What people keep forgetting to mention that MOST IF NOT ALL ARE HIGH DEFINITION ANDDDD THEY ACTUALLY BROADCAST HIGH DEF! I hate when sports bars try to show off their high def televisions yet broadcast blurry analog crap. 

I could imagine this place busy during a big game.  The pictures submitted fail to show the rest of the area. There is a small flight of stairs that leads to more room to drink on top of another huge TV. I believe there is a pool table also. 

I didn't find the drinks to be cheap nor expensive, but was made plenty strong.

If your looking to find a place to watch the game, i would recommend checking out this spot.
author: Eugene N.

description: Fun place to go to for the football games on Sunday.  They have a nice TV set up and you can be in any areas of the bar and can watch 5-7 Games at once.  Being from the east coast and recently moving to SF I was caught off guard with the fact that they don't serve food.  Pretty customary for people to come in with pizza boxes and take out to sit and watch some games. Beers are standard for a sports bar.  I wouldn't mind going back for a big game that I don't want to be intensely watching just because of the atmosphere.
author: Steven G.

description:
Greens is the biggest Carolina Panthers bar in San Francisco. It's easily the best place to watch the best team in football play. The staff is great, crowd is fun, overall its just a great time to watch Cam, Steve and the rest of the Panthers.

Yes We Cam.
author: Evan F.

description:
Ok, I like greens and all, but I had this crazy crazy thing happen to me a long while back.  I wrote a draft about it, not wanting to post an angry review.  But really, this was just beyond all levels of ridiculousness and i think it should be out there:
Around midnight, I like to pull this little trick were I switch from vodka soda to just soda.  I have never once in any bar been charged for this.  I have done this probably 2-3 times at Greens.
So let me tell you about this afternoon at Greens while I'm watching the game (sober, because I need to drive later might I add):
Me: "Hi, can I get a sparking water?"
Bartender (rudely) "you mean soda water?"
Me: "Yeah"
Bartender "OK, two dollars"
Me with a confused expression on my face: "really?" (i really didn't know if he was serious or not)
Bartender: "yeah really."  He looks angry.
Me: "oh, (regrouping so I can get cash from my other half who is seated with our friends who have racked up a hefty bar tab- might I add.)  "sorry, I didn't know.  i have ordered that here before and never been charged for it"  As I obtain the cash...
Bartender (very rudely): "you really shouldn't say that to me, I'm the owner I don't want to hear that."  
Me "oh ok, well, sorry, I just didn't expect to be charged; no big deal."  (cash is in my hand, waiting for him to take it)
Bartender, in an accusatory tone "We always charge for that, my bartenders don't give away free drinks  (repeating himself)  I am the owner I don't want to hear that my bartenders are giving away drinks."
Me (I really just want him to take my money at this point and leave me alone): "oh OK well, if it is a problem then you should take it up with your nighttime bartenders (ie not me)." 
Bartender: "that guy right there is my nighttime bartender.  do you know his name?"  (WTF?)
Me: "no, I don't know his name"
Bartender, "exactly, you've never gotten this for free here, so don't make things up."  
EXCUSE ME?
Me: "ok, well i'm not making anything up (I can feel my face getting hot). Here."  I motion to the cash hoping he will take it and end the conversation.
Bartender "I don't want your money."  
WHAT?  Then what the heck was all that about?  Now I am mad.  I would've gladly given him TEN bucks if I could have avoided this confrontation.  
Me "No really please, take it, I am happy to pay, it is only 2 dollars, I was just surprised, that's all.  I want to pay for it."
Bartender, "nope, and usually we charge 3$ for it."
I really don't want his condescending charity.  I don't need free drinks.  
Me: "then please put it in the tip jar"
Bartender, " I am the OWNER, I don't take tips."
I GET IT DUDE, YOU'RE THE OWNER!!!
Me, "then please take it and put it in the tip jar for your other bartenders"
he takes it, I enjoy my 2$ water infused with bubbles.  
COMPLETELY UNNECESSARY 
If I were a bar owner, here is how i would have handled that situation.  "Oh really, you've never been charged for it before?  well, i am sorry for the inconsistency.  this is something that we usually do charge for. I will discuss it with my bartenders to make sure they are charging people correctly for these kind of things" (instead of harassing you, a patron of my establishment whose late night drinking foolishness with large groups of friends helps pay my bills).  "That will be 2$.  Thanks!"
author: Kari P.

description: Tiny place. First sports bar I've ever gone to and been told they're "at capacity". And I traveled across town, based on the reviews I read. Waste of time!
author: Don C.

description:
So you thought I got soft b/c I was dishing out 5 stars like free condoms on a college campus.

Syke.

Green Sports Bar, sorry, no 5 stah foh yu.

I know you've got a plethora of sports memorabilia on your wall, but framing random Sports Illustrated magazines from the past isn't suffice.

Your biggest bonus: I can bring in outside food, thanks.

Sure it's rowdy, but hey it's sports and who doesn't cheer for their favorite team?

Other than that, come find me next door at the Bucaneer.
author: Dave K.

description:
Good bar. Seating available if you get there 15 minutes before the big game of the night. Waitress will be there about two drinks before you're done and the crowd is fun and cordial to both sides of whatever team you're routing for. 

I wish they served some kind of food, even popcorn or pretzels would be nice. The sound on the back room is also not wired right for the main tv, so you can't make out what the announcers are saying.
author: Chris M.

description:
I was at Greens Sports Bar today and discovered a dangerous game that is also a lot of fun. For $1, you can pick between several video games (such as a 3D boggle-ish game, etc) and win money if you do extremely well. It's tough but a lot of fun!

$15 buckets of (5) Budweiser's are also good and getting to pick which sports games are on which screens if you ask nicely is cool too....
author: Meghan P.

description: Not bad good sports bar, minimum tab for credit card is what makes this place skippable.  Super inconvenient
author: Jay H.

description: prices ridiculously high for beer. Lexi (probably other guy) conveniently added a $10.00 tip for herself) on an already tipped bill.
author: Gary N.

description: $3 Lagaunitas IPA draft beers demands nothing less than 3 starts. Seems to be a solid sports bar. Will definitely be back. Worth a stop.
author: Sean S.

description:
Sometimes all I want from a bar is my favorite beer on tap.  I would follow Shock Top to the ends of the Earth.  Well, if he ever returned any of my calls.  Or texts.  Or emails.  Or facebook messages.  Or smoke signals.  Or missives sent by carrier pigeon.  Or those notes I tape to his door.  Unrequited love is tough, especially when your desired lover is a beer.   

Bottomline: The Greens is awash in verdant tones and a falsely clean appearance.  Less TVs than I would expect for a sports bar.  They have food?  I pegged it as a standard watering hole.  Then I saw Shock Top behind the bar and I became smitten.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
Alright, so I have a love hate relationship going on with this bar. 
Love the location
Hate some patrons - Ass grabbers!
Love cocktails
Hate crowded game days
Love one of the bartenders
Hate the other ones
Love the divey atmosphere with roomy space
Hate the bouncer that wont let me in when it is not over crowded
and the list will go on because I will continue to go there...
author: Dee C.

description: The perfect sports bar in an awesome neighborhood!   There are about 20 TVs to watch games.  Tons of beer options and friendly bar keeps.
author: Frank M.

description: Great place to watch college football. It opens at 9am game days.
author: Ashraf A.

description:
The Greens Sports Bar saves me from needing to buy expensive cable packages, and provides me with great amounts of fermented goodness.  God bless you, The Greens Sports Bar.

Everyone here's always been really cool; there's a Chinese place down the street I usually grab take out from on my way to watch a game.

Edit 6/5/08: Chinese place appears to have been vandalized and closed.  Guess I'll have to remember to RSVP at Pesce from now on.
author: Tasha D.

description:
This bar was a nice change of pace for us. We just left a jam packed, very loud Tonic and really just wanted a place to get a few drinks and actually sit and catch up.. On a Saturday night, after 11p, there was room at the bar, and a few empty tables. Perfect for this pit stop. 
All the photos and memorabilia are interesting, if not a bit cliche. But really, what would be a fresh take on a sports bar?
author: Meg W.

description:
I love this bar. It makes me smile. It is one of those bars that you can go into any time of day/night and have a great time. If you go early in the evening to watch a game, you can have great conversation with the bartender and other sports enthusiasts. They also have pretty good beer deals early on. Everyone is really nice and friendly. If you go at night, it gets a lot more packed, but if you don't like people, stay home! 

They don't serve food, but they order in frequently and I have seen a customer order in like it was his second home. 

The only reason I dock them a star is because they have so many hats and pennants and sports paraphernalia hanging in the bar, but they do not have my favorite team!!! I love my college and it is a popular one, but not good enough for them!! This doesn't stop me from going in and watching the games, because I love everything else about the place, so don't miss out. 

I love that this place is similar to the marina sports bars, but gets me out of the marina once and a while. Also, if you don't like the frat boy/sorority chick scene (which I don't mind), this place is a nice change from the marina.
author: M M.

description:
Nice sports bar with a good selection of beers on tap and a good amount of seating for the patrons. Also a pool table in the back, usually covered up during sporting events that attract high volume. There is an out door seating patio and the crowd is youthful and attractive.

The bar gets extremely packed for big sporting events, so either arrive early or don't show up. Parking is atrocious, but once you are in its a good ol' time.
author: Phil H.

description:
Green's gets the important stuff right.
1-Lots of high def TVs with good sightlines
2-Nice beer selection
True it doesn't serve food and it gets packed on football weekends, but can't think of a better place to watch a game otherwise (especially week nights) .. unless you're a Raiders fan. In that case you'd be better off spending your Sunday outdoors or volunteering.
author: Neil C.

description:
Serviceable sports bar on Polk St in Russian/Nob Hill hood. 15+ TV's with all the different sports packages. Kinda weird watching puck at 4pm, but I'll take it along with the 1/2 price drafts on a day when I'm "working mobiley" while traveling.  

Also, tons of cool sports pics and memorabilia on the walls and a billiard table in the back. 

SF isn't really a hockey hotbed, but the friendly patrons were cheering along with me as my Flys squashed the Buffa-blow Sabres. Now that my team is 1-0 while I watched from this spot, I will now insist on watching any and all games here when I return.
author: John L.

description: Best Bar in town to watch the Carolina Panthers - Go Cats!
author: Andrew S.

description: March Madness at Green's. Hit two out of three bets, not a bad day. Always a good time with reasonable drink prices.
author: Jason B.

description:
Equipped with more flat-screens than Circuit City and more backwards baseball caps than Boston, this is the only place to be on Sunday.  They don't serve food here, but you can bring in whatever you want, so long as it isn't coffee. The wait staff is friendly, the $3 pints come quickly and the bouncers will let you yell as loud as you like.

Just get here early if you want a seat, because it gets real crowded real fast unless the Lions are playing.
author: Aaron G.

description: Good sports bar, seems like you can never get here early enough. Strangely like all SF sports bars, as opposed to places back east, none serve food.  No reason to come here unless there i s a game on...
author: Jim B.

description:
I just went to this Polk St bar last night and I had a great time despite the Longhorns loss.  I mean it is your run of the mill sports bar complete with 18 some odd TVs to watch whatever sport or team you want.  It was very crowded but everyone there was friendly especially the Texas fans!  

The bartender was great! I jumped into corner and despite the crowd of people waiting he got my beer right away and remembered me and my Miller lite everytime I returned, talk about service.  I love not even having to ask!
author: meagan M.

description:
Great sports bar being that I am usually able to find a seat!  And if I can't, the standing room is comfortable enough since there are TVs everywhere you look.
The sports memorabilia tacked to every wall (and even the ceiling) is of a good variety (not just local teams), although I'm not sure why there's a photo of Ellen Degeneres in the middle of the wall by the tables in the back.  

PROS:
-Pretty big inside - finding a place to sit isn't too hard (depends on who's playing).
-Fast bartenders.
-Crowd never gets too rowdy.
-Outside food is ok inside.

CONS:
-Russian Hill drink prices.
author: Ryan T.

description: This Place is awesome to watch any sports games. I was there a few weeks ago coming from So Cal to catch the Niners game on MNF. They might not have food here but the cool thing is you can order from the burger spot across the street and bring it back while you enjoy your beer.
author: Mike B.

description:
Disclaimer --  I could care less whose local area sports team is doing things with their balls better than other local area sports teams.  Not a sports guy.  The stuff happening on the television is a screensaver to me and the people reacting to it are entertainment -- I go there to people watch, eat cheap fried food, and pound drinks with friends.

That said, I love sports bars.  

As it pertains to my sports bar usage criteria, Green's is not a bad one, but not a great one.  Its divided into three zones so the energy of the crowd seems diffused.  It's also got this cheap pizzeria vibe to it and is lit awkwardly.  The sound was also off on a lot of the TVs which I thought was odd.  Nevertheless, it attracts the fun Post street bar hopping crowd and serves its purpose.  

Not my favorite sports bar but I'd gladly return for the nice people that run the place when I'm in the mood to watch the alpha mammals yell at their televised heroes.
author: niero g.

description: This sports bar is a great place to catch a game.  They have a pretty ludicrous amount of TVs in there, and there is no way that you won't see what you want.  Bartenders are fun - they know their football, and can carry some good conversations.  Great selection of beers on tap.  Not too expensive, pretty typical.  No food, but you can order in, and they have a book of menus behind the bar if you ask.  They have a crapload of stuff on the walls, all sports memorabilia.  You could hurt your neck if you look too long - there's a lot of stuff up there, every square inch is used.  This is my go-to place in the neighborhood for catching a game and drinking a few beers.  Good atmosphere and patrons, usually doesn't get terribly crowded (you can walk through the bar!), and plenty of televisions.
author: Nick B.

description: Solid sports bar. Reasonably priced drinks and lots of TV's.
author: Scoot S.

description: Cool sports bar with bunch of tvs. Takes a while to get a drink even when pretty slow
author: Matthew M.

description:
I LOVE THIS BAR.  I had an old high school friend that used to live in San Fran and my one friend and I would go down to hang out with her every Saturday just so we could wake up Sunday morning and watch the football games.  You can walk in there wearing any jersey and you'll find your fans from a small market team to the 49er's/Raiders, there's all sorts of fans there.  

The place gets really crowded so if you want a seat you have to show up a little before the games start.  The service is good, those poor waitresses find their way through shoulder to shoulder people carrying those treys of booze without spilling and are always there in time so you're never waiting for your drink.  

They don't serve food, but there's plenty of good food places in the area you can step out and take back into the bar to eat.
author: Matthew P.

description:
All that wall space covered with not-particularly-valuable sports memorabilia could be donated for some larger flat screens.

Because of the small screens, and because this place gets packed tighter than Beyonce's hot pants, I consider this more of a hang out/meet new faces bar than a sports bar.  Polk Street has better offerings for that.
author: Dmytro A.

description: Classic dive bar. Lots of space and decently priced drinks. Doesn't totally float my boat, but a good casual place to hang out and watch a game, which I don't enjoy, but I'll tag along with friends.
author: Bridget B.

description: We got in line to watch the niners playoff game at 10am.  You would think they would open a little early but instead with a line down the corner the bar tenders, bar backs and waiters sat inside and drank beers, read the newspaper and didn't open the doors till well after noon with a crowd of a hundred people waiting Iine to be customers.  I don't know if it was a power trip or this bar is a non profit because it makes no sense to me.  Get it together! I'm a local and my whole group of neighbors will not be coming back here, absolutely ridiculous!!!
author: J B.

description: If you ever have fraternity brothers in town and wanna go to a good sports bar this is probably the most appropriate spot.
author: Roger H.

description:
I hate most sports. The only thing I really watch is tennis or Cal football. Probably, Greens isn't really the place for me.

That being said, it's not a bad bar. The bartenders are super nice, the drinks are cheap, and you can order Polkers burgers and curly fries across the street and eat them while you're watching the big game. 

If you're a girl looking to get hit on here, it's probably not going to happen if a game is on. Most of the guys' eyes are unwaveringly glued to one of the 100 television screens on the wall. If they do happen to waver during a commercial break, the pick-up line you are most likely to hear is "So, what team are you rooting for?"

My answer is always the same - "I couldn't care less."
author: Ava S.

description: I like baseball, but watching football is not really my thing. But watching football at a sports bar like this makes it much more enjoyable. The crowd is rowdy and fun, and there is plenty of seating. I also like the front outdoor  area to sit and it's in a cute neighborhood. I don't think I would ever choose to come here, but if all of my guy friends want to watch a game here, I would definitely come back.
author: Sonya D.

description:
Memorabilia, ample number of tvs, zona games, sports fans, beer.  I need not say much more.  Food would be the icing on the cake, but that lineup is not too shabby.  It gets mad, almost angry crowded on game days, especially pro football and even college.  This can lead to a less than desirable experience if you can't get a seat and you're starting to sweat from all of the intoxication and body heat.  However, just because it's popular doesn't mean it deserves to get dinged.  

When all is said and done, for location and the aforemetioned reasons, it's probably my favorite sports bar in SF.  Though final final is up there.   

One major recommendation: replace the large, outdated TV in the back with a 50-60 inch Samsung flat screen.
author: Adam S.

description:
This place first opened 20 years ago and has successfully maintained a storefront on the ever-changing Upper Polk scene. Name more than one or two other bars or restaurants on this street who have matched that! They must be doing something right.

It's not a perfect bar, but it's a nice place to get lost when it's not jammed for a big game. You can sit at the bar or grab a nice long table, throw down some food from a nearby restaurant, drink a beer, catch an obscure NBA or NHL game on one of the zillion flat-screeen TVs, and waste away.

The jukebox is state-of-the-art where you can download any song available on the internet. That's also good on a slow night.

Don't come here expecting the bartenders to be charming actors. They have been jaded from having survived a month of drunken Saturdays and Sundays, where they have no doubt worked their ass off for hours on end with no time for small talk. This is where there's room for improvement.

If you go there on a Sunday afternoon, you will have the pleasure of running into Serge, the owner, who started it all 20 years ago. He also grew up down the street, so he gives the place local cred.

Greens is a place  you can walk into no matter what you're wearing and not feel so out of place, another nice option for this neighborhood.

The walls have great memorabilia. And the pool table in the back is one of only two in the neighborhood, the other being at the cubby-hole Buccaneer. 

Bottom line: great selection of beers, lots of room, any game you want to watch will be on  a state-of-the-art flat screen TV, pool table and great jukebox. One star off for the often-aloof bartenders.  So don't go there if you want to strike it up with the bartender. Strike it up with someone else in the room!.
author: Nitram N.

description: I love coming here to watch games (especially when there are three different games of different spots are playing at the same time). I especially love it here during NCAAFB season (can it be September yet?!?!). Come here, get a bucket, and order food from you favorite nearby restaurant.
author: Janny N.

description:
Right off the club, pun intended, I'm really not into golf. (Where is the Cubs themed bar?)  So going to a bar with golf terminology in the title means it' probably not going to be my kinda place.  It's a sports bar, complete with a butt load of signed pictures of famous people and semi-famous people.  

Jager shots for everyone!  It's rowdy-loud in the young professional remembering college way.  When there's girls, this is where you'd go to find mrs. right now.  There's always tons of people for happy hour.  

Bro!, you'll have fun if you go.
Just wear something stain proof.
author: Jake H.

description:
$8 for 2 local beers and 2 good imported beers + table service during happy hour! That's pretty good for Russian Hill, right?

This isn't to say Green's is one of those dives you need a stiff drink before entering (that'll be the local adult entertainment establishment thank you) - to the contrary you can walk in stone sober, watch a little sport, shoot some pool, meet some friendly characters and walk out feeling pretty good.

I love a bar that isn't precious about you BYO food. The crowd is like a typical sports bar mob but more friendly. It might sound odd that i find Green's really clean for bar... its clean even in the women's restroom. The bar gets crowded during major sporting events (last night was World Series Game 1) and has a great atmosphere. 

Few minor problems - ventilation in the back area isn't good, and swelters when there are so many bodies in the house. Second fault is that it takes forever to get a drink when its busy... but then, so does every other bar if its packed.

Last night I sat on the windowsill with my backside half hanging outside the bar - inspiring all those gym goers passing by to an extra 20 on the treadmill, no doubt. Our group spoke to people on the street, in the bar, anyone who wanted to chat to us really. It was really cool way to spend a warm Wed night.

There isn't anything  revolutionary to this review, really, other than yep - recommend that you drop by sometime for a mid-week bevvie.
author: Joyce L.

description:
This place is a sports bar on steroids.  We get it, ok?  You have every single penant for every single team covering every single inch of your wall.  Actually, I think I saw a spot by the pool table where you can tack up just ONE more piece of memorabilia.  

The first time I ever came here was to meet some random Bro-seph from Craigslist to buy his concert tickets.  Not the easiest place to meet a complete stranger on a Friday night.  

I will give them this though; they've found their theme and they're sticking to it.  Also, my crowd of coworkers have had some really pleasant happy hour experiences here because there is a ton of room to spread out and not be packed in with 10,000 other people.  We also received excellent service from our waitress, who always made sure everyone had a full drink.
author: Kerry D.

description: This place is kind of hit and miss..during NCAA Football season it gets pretty fucking packed. Upside is there's usually cool people to bullshit with about the game..the downside is it can be difficult to get a drink and damn near impossible to get a seat. They don't sell pitchers which sucks, but they sell buckets of beer. Bottom line: This place is servicable in a pinch, but there are better options..
author: Morris D.

description:
Do you wish you were an i-banker or a lawyer? Claim to run a hedge fund, but really make the office coffee? If so, Greens may be the place for you.

I got a whole lotta douche vibe from Greens while attempting to enjoy a Cal game.

Also the service was atrocious. Chain of events goes something like this: we order drinks from waitress. She leaves and comes back 20 minutes later sans drinks in hand, instructs us to continue waiting. Another 15 minutes pass and she returns with drinks. Fucking pathetic.

Fail.
author: jack p.

description:
Morning.... well my morning 3:30 pm on Sunday.  What do you need after the best weekend ever, full of drinking and bar hoping??  Come on now, A Bloody Mary.  That is exactly what I needed to pick me up!  

I have been to Greens Sports bar before, my last and probably favorite was watching the Lakers get smashed in the final game of the 2008 NBA Playoffs.  Man that was a good day.  But this day was almost as good, maybe even as good.  But good atmosphere with plenty of places to sit which I like a lot and you can even sit near the open window so Its like your sitting outside but minus the gusts of wind and sprinkling of the fog.

Definitely a place to go watch sports there are plenty of TVs!
author: Megan L.

description:
Why Five Stars?  
True sports bar - check
MLB Package - check
$2.50 Guinness - check (must have been happy hour)

I'll let them slide for having no food since there are places nearby and the owners being Yankee fans.  Most of the TVs are small but they have a ton of them.  And last time I was there I met some fellow Cubs fans which was a bonus.  I will be returning here down the stretch run the next couple of weeks and hopefully in October (knock on wood).
author: Tom K.

description:
This place was second stop on a golf-themed pub crawl I went on late last year.  We missed out on Tonic, so me and my golf pub crawl partner, Ashton C., had to catch up by drinking extra booze here. For a couple of dipsomaniacs like us, this was no big deal.

Unfortunately, the bartenders, or one specifically, seemed to be in a bad mood when we got there. I smiled at him and asked for two shots a Jack and two Sierra Nevadas. He looked at me and said he had no Jack. What kind of sports bar runs out of Jack? 

I did not let it bother me. I figured Patron was a better idea, anyway. But every time he poured a drink, he just seemed extremely annoyed. Maybe something happened earlier, but I kept ordering politely with a smile and he just kept giving me some weird attitude. 

Normally, I'd give a place like this, with its multiple big screens and stuff, at least 3-stars. But the service left something to be desired.
author: Archie G.

description:
So I FINALLY managed to have a good time at Greens!

Maybe it was helped along by the buckets of Miller High Life ($15/5) and the good company, my friend who is an Oklahoma alum as well as the ass kicking Sooners.

I'm hella on the Oklahoma bandwagon.

Wait what's that? Oh, I said I think football is boring?
 
Do you know what is not boring?

HOT MIDWESTERN MEN
author: Katie H.

description:
Ah, Greens Sports Bar...where would I be without you? You air Denver Bronco games, provide menus for delivery when I'm too lazy to go get food myself, and you don't judge me for my repeated requests for double shots of vodka on a Sunday afternoon.

When there's a serious game on, this place can get CROWDED, but in addition to the staff, the people who frequent Greens are pretty damn cool. In the past two or three years, I've only had one incident with a drunken group of wannabe frat guys, and the bartender came to my rescue and told them to cool it or get out. Needless to say, they stumbled out pretty fast. It's nice when people have your back :)

Also, most of the customers here, in my experience, has been really polite, even when it's crowded as hell and seats are limited. It's not unusual for someone to give up their place at the bar or let you sit at their table while you wait for your own spot. 

Overall, this is my favorite sports bar in the city,primarily because it's pure sports. Check out the memorabilia covering the walls. The jukebox is also a must, especially when your team wins and you want to to rock out with a victory song (and a double shot of vodka, which the bartender just might share with you).
author: Hilary L.

description:
Great spot to watch football games. They have a lot of TV's so all the different games are shown. Been here a few times and there is always a huge college football crowd. I've seen my alma mater represented well, too - the University of Washington - gotta love that (expect for our HORRIBLE HORRIBLE DISGRACEFUL season this year)

Definitely a great place to catch the game!
author: Ian C.

description:
Somehow every single time I come here, I end up making out with someone I meet inside. Maybe its because I convince myself that Jager is just dark water, or because I tend to enjoy having heavy-lidded expressions to further muddle my surroundings(its on purpose, I swear). 
Or maybe I just like to make out. 
Either way, I heart it so because you can order food in (nothing like having hot men offer you yummy Amici's pizza when you least expect it), or you can run down to Nick's Crispy Tacos and have some rockin make out breath for the frat boy that is yelling at some over-sized television about something I don't care about.
Oh wait, this is a sports bar? Opps.
author: Ashley H.

description:
A good neighborhood sports bar.  I would probably come a lot if it were in my neighborhood and not on the other side of town.

Like most of SF, it can get crowded, but you should be able to find yourself a seat for the game if you show up a bit early.  There is no food, which is somewhat annoying but mitigated by the fact that you can send a friend to get takeout at many restaurants down the street and they don't mind if you bring it in.  You can even order delivery to the bar itself from certain places.

There are lots of TVs but no sound on any of the games.  Draft beers of the non-yuck variety are 5 bucks.  Many people here even on a big sports day are not here to watch the game.

And I have to mention the rudeness of some of the patrons, because beyond people's general glaring (and a mocking mimic of my "excuse me!') as I tried to maneuver the crowds, I had two really eyebrow-raising experiences there in just one afternoon.  

First, after sitting down at an empty table at which a friend joined me a few minutes later, I was confronted by a pair of guys who told us that "they were sitting there" and had just gone over to the bar to order drinks.  No problem, we said, here are two or three empty seats and we certainly don't mind sharing the table.  Not only did they insist they needed the whole table for their not yet present friends, but one suggested that what I had done by sitting down while they were apparently hovering somewhere in the vicinity while leaving nary a sweatshirt to mark their place was "a real dick move."  We were able to negotiate a solution, but unnecessary conflict is never a positive.

Later, I was waiting in line for the ladies' room staring a door that seemed like it would NEVER open.  The woman in front of me in line finally broke down and started knocking to see what was up.  The door IMMEDIATELY opened and out popped another woman, on her cell phone, who said "Sorry, I didn't realize there was a line!"  To be fair, I guess you would not technically know whether or not there was a line if you are LOCKED inside the only bathroom stall in the place, on the phone.  But really, could you just step outside?

I personally will never go back here, but if it's around the corner from you it's definitely worth checking out.  I'm not factoring the rudeness into my ranking because I've only been once and I'm hoping it could be a fluke.  If not, these are your neighbors and you may have grown a thicker skin than mine by now!
author: Elisabeth D.

description:
I didn't know a bar could have so many freakin' TVs. I think there is a TV in every possible corner of this bar. It's awesome. As soon as a commercial comes on you can just kind of crack your neck a bit towards the left or right and OH MY GOD!! there is another TV with some other game on. I am so happy here. 

Plus, Polkers is across the street and you can go get a burger and come back and finish your Guinness. Mm. Happiness.
author: Annie T.

description: Awesome sports bar with super cool staff. This is my spot for niners away games and Sundays = $3 drafts. Bloody mary's are pricey at about $9 and not that tasty but chicks shouldn't be allowed into a sports bar anyways - kidding. Packers and raven fans flock here so get here at 10 to ensure seating.
author: Joe C.

description:
Decent beer selection.  Tons of dated sports memorabilia on the walls, including some choice SI Swimsuit Issues from the 1980s.  

It is what it is.  Not exciting, but no attitude either.

But it is awesome that they let you bring in food.  We had a pizza delivered from Escape from New York, a block away.
author: Aaron T.

description:
I seem to be going here a bit more often as of late, and I also seem to be having an upswing in hangovers. Coincidence? Definitely yes.  Maybe serving food here could help a bit with that (hint)?

Let's see...
1) Green's is educational. I recently learned how to play a nice little dice game called 1-4-24 and quickly lost the remaining small bills in my wallet.

2) Green's promotes unity. After drinking all day and watching the Yankees play the Red Sox, NY finished with a victory. As the fans celebrated and New York New York played on the speakers, I politely asked a Sox fan why Boston doesn't have a Sinatra song sung about it. Unexpectedly he took offense to this and to my Indian friend, who is also an NY fan and who may have said something as well (not sure). Then the Sox fan threatened to take his glasses off and go at it.  Now there's some global unity.

3) Greens is entertainment.  Drink 12 beers, do a shot of jager, and then just watch the arcade football game in the back.  I swear the cheerleaders want me!
author: Dave L.

description:
My favorite sports bar. The most important part is that they get sports via satellite, so they pretty much have any game you can think of.

Happy hour from 4-7 on the weekdays. It is hard to beat $2.25 for a good draft beer. Also, even though they don't serve food here, they have a big book of menus. You can bring food in with you and chow down. This is probably better than if they served their own food.

They get one star off because I came here once when the owner was tending bar...and he was kind of a jerk.
author: Stu M.

description: Green's is my favorite bar in the city. I've been going there for years now and the initial draw was to watch the Buckeyes play. During college football season you can't beat this place (if you like college football). A lot of Pac-10 schools are represented but also a good amount of mid-western and east-coast schools as well. Great energy, great staff, great times.
author: Josh A.

description: This place would be pretty decent if they would get new bartenders.  Never seen someone so miserable and slow behind a bar.  After waiting 20 minutes to get a drink when it wasn't even that busy and receiving angry/ annoyed glares from the bartender, we decided to leave.  Not worth it.
author: Natasha S.

description:
Oafish guy with backwards baseball cap sitting next to me: "You know, I used to be the president of my Frat."
Me (desperately scanning the bar looking for my friend): "Oh yeah. Neat."
Self-proclaimed king of the frats: "Yeah it was awesome. So what sorority were you in?"
Me (dying to leave): "Um, I wasn't in one. I went to a small liberal arts..."
Frat guy (in semi-caveman grunt): "Shhh, game is back on."

This is pretty standard for any interaction I've had at this bar, which is never ever some place I would go and is more of a place I get dragged to by a sports loving friend who just HAS to see the score of whatever stupid sporting event is on.  It can get really really crowded and almost impossible to get the bartenders' attention. My only reason for not giving it one star is that the drinks are actually pretty cheap during happy hour and if a game is not on it's moderately (note ONLY moderately) tolerable.
author: Rebecca H.

description:
Good:
1. On a sunday, it's crowded, but not in a bad way. We were able to find a table within a half hour.
2. Staff is friendly, service is relatively fast, even when crowded (like on a Sunday).
3. Drink specials are decent, and they have every NFL game.

Not as Good:
1. I could have done without the Jets fan screaming in my ear. 
2. Sometimes when i'm here on the weeknights, the beer is a bit stale.




I live pretty close to Greens, so it gets a lot of points for being within walking distance
author: Manlio L.

description:
The best time to go here is when Dave (?) is working! My boyfriend has frequented this bar quite a bit since he moved here 1+ year ago, so I feel like an inherited regular. 

It's a great place to go with friends - great selection of beer for cheap, ask Dave for his "signature" drink.. it's a delicious concoction! It's true about the bathrooms, only one ladies room (as in one room, one toilet) usually occupied by a swarm full of giggling girls in tiny clothes regardless of the temperature (hello? Its a sports bar!)..

Its good. Good people. I like it... you can play pool and draw obscene pictures on the chalk board.
author: Valerie W.

description: Great place to watch a game (provided you get there early enough to secure a seat or two), meet some friendly customers and have a bucket full of beers. I went here for the world cup and world series, and my only complaint is that they stopped letting people in -- did someone say capacity limit? fire marshall? so, sadly, we left to catch the game at a friends house. all in all, it's a great spot.
author: Sarah T.

description:
Love Greens -  its the only place where me and my sac town buddies can regularly watch the Sacramento Kings games.  There are a shit load of TV's, but I only care about the one that has Tyreke Evans tearing it up!

The bar has solid nightly beer specials.  3 dollar IPA night,  and so forth.    

I would never dream of coming here for an NFL game because it is soo packed and I can watch the niners from the comfort of my own 50 inch bitch.  I also think fans of all other teams but the niners are obnoxious - especially Cowboys, Seahawks, Steelers, and Giants.  Chargers fans piss me off too, and so do Patriot fans.  

Minus one star because of the biggest prick in the whole world who works there.  I hope you get your ass kicked  Mo FO!
author: Buddy Garrity L.

description:
Though I love this bar for its spaciousness, multitude of TVs simultaneously playing various sports games, decent drink poor and neighborhood crowd, I am offended with last nights treatment (or shall I say, my Dog was offended).  Many times I've been to this bar, and on slower nights when less crowded, I've witnessed many a-dogs accompanied by their owners here.  Heck, even I've been in there enjoying my libation with my pooch at my side and never was asked to leave.  For some reason last night I was asked to leave, which BTW it was slow however there were quite a few suit wearing folks and less t-wearing folks in attendance.  

Puzzled ~ how could this be; I've been here before with my beloved pet, why tonight?  Of course, I don't have the answer but gather by the evidence as stated above (suit wearing folks), the cocktail waitress wanted to make a good impression on the money crowd.  

What puzzles me more is, when asking me to leave, I told her I'd been in there before and it wasn't an issue.  Her response "well, certain bartender's don't want dogs in the bar".  My reply "well that's the same bartender and he didn't have a problem last time".  Her response, "well he's not supposed to allow dogs in, so your dog has to go"  

So contradictory; and yes, she was just doing her job.  I personally didn't loose sleep over it, but Blondie (aka "Dawg" ) was highly offended.
author: Cris B.

description: The bar itself is pretty cool.  Pretty standard drink prices.  The staff are not very friendly though.  I've sat at the bar before just hanging out, and they talk trash about the customers non-stop.  I'm sure this goes on at most places, but I expect a little more discretion about what you say in front of other customers.  Maybe I just caught them on a bad night
author: Ted G.

description:
Great place to watch the game...any game.  I usually like to come here during the first few days fo the NCAA tourney.

Ladies, if you are wondering where all the men in the city are, come to Greens.  You will be picked up on by some guy, if thats your thing, because chicks in sports bars are cool.  Balboa girls, not so much.  Greens girls rock...and I'm married...
author: Andrew C.

description:
This is a test.  I will play the following sound for you:

WOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO

Now, do you like this sound?  If so you will like Green's.   If not, go somewhere else.
author: Beau G.

description: Great place to watch the game or just hang out with the locals on any night! They play all the best games and the bartenders ( especially my favorite Kevin!!) know how to make a drink that really packs a punch! I love the Greens gang! Ask Kev for a Irish Car Bomb! You won't forget it...or maybe you will :)
author: Amy S.

description:
I think Greens is a great bar to watch the game if you like being with a crowd.  Late night can be fun if you are already in a group, but if there isn't  a game going on, then there are lot of better places to hang out on Polk.

I will say, during game-time, waitresses are awesome.  I never have to get up and order at the bar, they always swing by before I finish my beer.  I wish they had food, but its cool that no only do they let you bring food in, they even have menus for the places nearby.
author: Bobby J.

description:
Please move to another neighborhood....the quantity of boorish airhead
yuppie business school programmed prefab boozehounds that hang out here is an eye and ear sore....the one good thing is that it keeps them all
in one place....so raucous and the green colors hurt the eyes
author: david f.

description:
Drinks are expensive, service is usually pissed-off and angry -- and I would be, too, if I had to work in a sweaty, testosterone-coated, frat-boy-infested hellhole every day.

Boston expats can come here and ALWAYS get the game -- they even turned off the A's game because the Bruins-Canadiens went into overtime. That's cool. Less so are the lost-in-high-school polo-clad YAHDOODS barking in your ear all day/night  (isn't there a mixer back at the house? fuck off) and the $24 two shots and two beers will set you back. 

And popped collars?? What. The. Fuck. Don't even get me started on the salmon pants. 

Only go here if you absolutely have to -- like I did on Saturday, when BC won the m.f.ing  national championship game. And when you do, expect drunken 24-year olds named Sully wearing matching polos to mistake you for a Notre Dame fan (it was indeed GREEN, yet my shirt did say BOSTON, fucknut) and try to start some shit.
author: Chris R.

description:
A sports bar without food is like a Tarantino movie without the f word. It just doesn't seem like it would work. Luckily, the staff is cool enough to let you bring outside food in, and there is a good selection on this particular block of Russian Hill.

Prices are reasonable, tvs are big, and it's pretty easy to get a seat on gameday. The staff even tuned in the MSU game on one of the big tvs even though my friend and I were the only ones who wanted to see it. 

Great selection of beers on tap. Bathroom is disgusting, but what else would you expect? 

$20 minimum to start a tab, so order up the shots!
author: Don H.

description:
Ut oh - I think I was the dude with the shorts. Thanks for having my back Spice. Although they were seersuckers, so I probably deservered it. 

Back to Greens - this place sucks.  I'm not sure which is worse - the employees or the patrons. That about sums it up.
author: Michael D.

description:
Not a bad sports bar, though I don't like the angle of the TVs. Drinks aren't bad and they take cards, which is always a plus. I've seen it very empty and other times just packed. You can also bring in food from nearby places. Pizza is a good option. 

My one beef is with the customers. Come on, if you're going to go to a sports bar to drink, shouldn't you know your sports? Usually it just cracks me up how stupid some guys are about sports. Especially when they're trying to impress whoever they're with. Almost killed one guy once though. He sat that and provided his own play by play to the two women he was with. And it was beyond stupid. Example: Play was close to a backcourt violation, but not that close. Dumbass' commentary: Come on ref, that's a three second violation. Now I understand why other parts of the country say that Californians don't know sports. I'm embarrassed.
author: The Sock S.

description:
Green's was an early dish from the modern sports-bar-cookbook where the owner did little more than to follow a simple recipe: Find a mundane space, cover the walls with sports paraphernalia, and surround its periphery with a truckload of televisions. PRESTO!!   The result is society's current incarnation of a modern sports bar, and only a good location saves Green's from being a mundane one.

I talked to a guy who used to tend bar here.  He called it "an event bar", i.e., a normally quiet spot for midnight-mass sports fans to hang, hoot, and holler on big-game days.  People tend to show up in groups to watch the game, but all too often wind up yakking on their phones or flirting with someone at a nearby table.  Polk Street was part of my homeward jaunt from a regular client, so I used to cruise by this place mid-week at around 6:30 on Wednesdays. Unless something big was happening, it looked like any other neighborhood bar.  The place gets popular during March Madness, the NBA finals, and Sundays during football season.  Come the Super-bowl or any other highly anticipated game, The Upper Filmore/Union Street crowd flocks here droves, and it's packed to the rafters with the see-and-be-seen crowd.

An open-air patio looks over Polk street, while a pool table fills up the back.  Regular days have coverage of nearly every conceivable sporting event from Giants Games to Cricket Matches displayed across a massive array of televisions.  Some of the pictures on the wall are cool...but a lot are little more than filler, and the decent stuff gets lost in the shuffle amongst  eyes that are too young to remember, and too callous to care.  Game audio fills the room on key days...but otherwise the music is young, hip, and moderately loud.

Come game day it's packed with the young, the beautiful, and their usual throngs of pursuers.  If this is your scene, it's the place to be.  If it ain't, join me for cheaper drinks at a place with uglier patrons, half the screens, and twice the soul....
author: Mike W.

description:
This bar gets one star for being the social spot for a dear fried of mine. 

It gets half a star for the multiple televisions blasting any and all sports game currently on TV.
