The second half of that star goes to the space in the front of the bar near the open windows, facing Polk street.  

And the last star goes to the fact that despite the somewhat Marina-ness of some of the patrons, and that it can be more packed than a can of sardines, I've always managed to have a really good time here.  But most of that goes to my friends, who get an infinite number of stars.  Quishquish
author: Ria D.

description:
Somebody wrote: ' make sure you show up early to get a table'. 

Welllllll... that's what we did for the Germany-Italy World Cup game and the bar staff opened the doors 5 min before the game started..?!?!?! There was a line of about 40 ppl outside 30 min or more before the game. They could have made some money since everybody was just brown-bagging it. I really don't understand this especially since people were already working and the bar is supposed to open at 10AM on weekends. On top of that the main bartender that day was just really really unfriendly: "I will open at 11:30am.. oh you know what.. why don't I open at 11.55am.. would you like that, huh?!"

Unfortunately I will have to go back to this bar because watching the games is always fun and my friends don't care as much. They just really should work more on the bar staff attitudes.

(And I am not saying that it is an easy job but you could show some sort of excitement. People come to this bar with certain expectations & hopes for their teams and all they want  to do is have a fun day. I strongly believe that ppl need to have fun working at bars so if you don't please choose a different job)
author: Doro P.

description:
$10 for a shot glass of Makers.  Better to carry around a handy flask of your own?  You decide.

But Green's merits two stars for a fun crowd.
author: Kira K.

description:
So maybe I'm not the best person to rate this place especially because I'm not a fan of sports bars, but ME NO LIKEY. 

Bartender seemed totally disinterested and tuned out (when we came for another round he acted annoyed that he had to put down his magazine).

We left right after that.
author: Nenette Y.

description:
This bar is terrible.  The beer tastes like dirty, stinky feet, the bar tenders are thugs, and much of the clientele is of questionable character.  I heard one Jimbo making fun of some other dude's shorts.  "Seriously, are you wearing those?"  Wow, I hadn't heard such nonsense since high school.
Its one, saving grace?  It's on a great block on Polk Street in Russian Hill.  If you're desperate, walk in and have a bottled beer and leave soon after.
author: Spice O.

description:
Green's is a sad excuse for a sports bar.

When I first moved to SF, I was psyched to have sports bar just a few blocks away. That feeling of elation quickly sank into depression and then anger, as I realized how poor Green's is.

Key failures of Green's:
TVs - What kind of sports bar has CRT TVs these days? Where are my flat screens?

Food -- There is none.

Drink policy -- Nothing allowed in from the outside including drinks not served at Green's. So if I want to come in at 9am to watch an east coast game, and my gf wants to come with me and bring her Starbucks, she cannot even if I am buying drinks. This is BS and petty.

Bartenders -- They are for the most part dicks.


I leave 1 star since a number of the waitresses are sweet.
author: Nick L.

description: This place could use food and more popcorn, though they encourage you to bring your own. The drinks are nothing to write home about, though they have a daily happy hour - 1/2 price on drafts. Nice pool table and good if you want to watch a game with the locals.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Awful.  Just awful.  It's where former frat boys and their sad entourage go to watch sports and relive their glory days.

Avoid this place and head to Kezars.
author: Helen C.

description: OK spot to watch the game, unless everyone and their uncle have the same idea - then it's a sardine can where you're likely to get covered in beer and have people screaming in your ear.  but they do have Mirror Pond Pale Ale on tap, which is my favorite beer, so one extra star for that
author: Sage S.

description:
If you want to relive your days at Phi Kappa Delta, this is the place to go. There's more ass-slapping and male-on-male posturing than in most Castro bars, so if that's your thing, head on over. 

Bro.
author: Brandon B.

description:
hits greens up for the niner-lions game.  $15 buckets of coors light for $15 and $5 blue moons.  bat staff is spedy.  customers are friendly. the guys next to us offered the takeout menu binder in case we were hungry.  yes, many restaurant will deliver to green's.

plenty of screens and not a head in the way.  happy hour 4-7pm.
author: Sharlene C.

description:
I've been to this place a few times and enjoyed a few beers. The last time however my experience was how shall I put this diplomatically - trucking terrible! 

Me and my buddy roll into this place buzzing and my friend who was feeling a bit silly orders an Olde English as a joke. The bartender, unfortunately, is a beer nazi with no sense of humor. He refused to serve my friend and turned him away. It's Friday nite laugh at the joke for goodness sake!!  I, fortunately, received a beer and as I enjoyed it my friend makes another attempt to order a beer and we are both promptly kicked out!! I was like what the hell!? I didn't do fit!! I should really give this place 1 star but I'm a nice guy so 2 it is. Ironically I can see myself stumbling into this place again after a few.
author: Calvin C.

description:
Okay, I'm a forgive and forget when it comes to sh!tty attitudes from bartenders, maybe just having a bad day like everyone else.

But the guys who run Greens (Buffalo, NY transplants and still pissed off about it) treat alot of patrons like crap, and frankly it's gotten tedious over the years.

They used to have 2-fers tokens on MNF, which was a good thing, and occasionally a tolerable waitress.  Other than that, it's really a private dive bar that poses as a neighborhood sports bar.
author: PeterDragon D.

description:
If this place weren't mere blocks from my house, I would avoid it like the plague.  But considering that I sometimes like to blackout within walking distance, this will have to do.  

#1: The bartenders usually suck.  It doesn't matter if it's jam-packed or you can hear crickets, the tenders will take their sweet time getting around to serving you.  Mixed drinks (like my beloved vodka/soda) come in a pint glass.  At first you think "awesome! a double!" but after downing 4 to no avail, you realize they actually just fill the pint glass with a shit ton of soda and not so much vodka.  Just give it to me in its proper glass.  Stop getting my hopes up like that. 

This place is usually packed, the staff sucks but it has slightly redeemed itself by allowing you to order in food.
author: Kathleen B.

description:
As a UCLA alum living in the city, our group of fellow bruins would frequent Greens to watch college football and NCAA tourney games, and we always had a good time, partly because the place was always filled, partly because our teams usually win, but mostly because we were just drunk and didn't really care where we were or who was around us.

That said, since the end of college sports season, I've been back to Greens a few times, and it hasn't quite been the same experience.  Last time I was there, our group spotted some obnoxiously golf attire dressed yuppies on some lame beer bar treasure hunt where they wouldn't even stop for a beer.  Any establishment that tolerates and/or welcomes that kind of nonsense is docked down a few points in my book.  And this wasn't the first occasion, there's usually some alpha-male Stanford d-bags who look like they want to pick a fight, if only I could disregard my principles for one minute and use my martial arts skills on them.  But I digress...

Whatever, there's a happy hour special on any given day, and there's lots of tvs showing sports, so a star for each in my book.  Just don't irritate me or my group, or else you just might end up eating a spinning back kick to your face.
author: Michael P.

description:
A total and complete crap-shoot. If the Yankees win, it's unbearable, but if they lose, you can tell all the annoying bandwagon riding, Jersey trash douchebags that hang out here to suck it!!

...then you should probably run.
author: Andrew L.

description: We came to Greens with 15 people to watch the first college football game of the season, TN vs. NC St.  There were 3 other people there when we arrived.  We asked the bartender if he would put the sound on for the game, and he said "no way, neither team is ranked".  I asked who would be offended and he said lots of people wanted to watch the Michigan State game.  There was one guy at the bar who was a Michigan State fan.  The bartender continued to have a terrible attitude, so we moved our crew to the Brickyard and they set us up with our own section, sound, etc.  The Brickyard was a blast and had a lot of fun people there watching sports.  We spent over $400 during the game so it was definitely a bad call on the part of the Green's bartender.  I will never go there again.
author: Hill J.

description:
1. We showed up here at 9:30am for football on Sunday, only to be laughed at by the bartender (-1 star) who oh so kindly informed us that the doors opened at 9:50am (-1 star).  

2. The servers scour if you try to bring in beverages, so when the doors open at 9:50 you're faced with the choice of chugging your coffee or getting a good seat. (-1 star)

3. A bucket of beer is $10 (+1 star), a Coke is $2.25...no free refills (-1 star).  Seriously, I didn't want to drink at 10am on Sunday morning, but you do the math.  What's a poor girl to do?!
author: Dawn J.

description:
Cheap drinks and lots of TVs (I think this place has more TVs than Best Buy) to watch USC football annihilate everyone else.  Other than that nothing special. 

The crowd can be fun most of the time but watch out for the meatheads and the college kids that still think that being in a frat is cool.

Sign that I am drunk: When I start yelling "I love you guys" to my friends and random strangers. It seems to happen quite often at Green Sports Bar.
author: Arin N.

description:
I have spent my fair share of time at Greens and after last weekend decided it is a well below average sports bar.  Couple things really play against it.  
1) Could use more TV's
2) when spending 3+ hours watching a game and having a couple drinks it would be nice if they served food.
3) The biggest problem is this place might have the worst staff in San Francisco.
author: Matt B.

description: My favorite sports bar in the entire city!  Although it does get pretty packed during big games and NFL season, it is still a blast.  Good drink specials and fans from just about every team make it a fun atmosphere to watch the games.
author: Cameron M.

description:
This place is good if you want to run into a that frat guy who barfed on your shoes five years ago.  And then when he tells you he's a corporate lawyer and introduces you to his skinny, blonde girlfriend you can barf on his shoes back.

Go Bears!
author: Mz M.

description:
Hope to try this another time and maybe be able to write a nicer review, but a friend and I went here last week on Friday or Sat night, it was packed, and ONE f@cking bartender?  Are you serious?  Everyone in there is retarded drunk, I mean, it's kind of a guy's place, and everyone seems to be ordering shots, beers, for large amounts of people.  The crowd is not lightweights, you know?  Seems like you'd know having one bartender on a Fri or Sat is just not going to cut it.  My friend and I waited about 15 minutes at the bar with money in our hands and never got waited on.  We finally left that sausage party.  We laughed about it later, I mean, we like going places we can find guys, but I told her some of the people there were so wasted I'd be afraid if we talked to someone they might just projectile vomit on us.  Maybe it was just the guy next to us who looked like he wouldn't be able to get up from his barstool, but whose friends kept feeding him more shots.  

Oh yeah it kind of smelled like farts in there.  I guess that's what you get in a bar full of drunken dudes?
author: Muriel D.

description: I used to know a bunch of rugby players that lived upstairs so obviously the bias lies in the good times that would extend to the entire property as a full-throttle frat house.  But I'd say if you like watching a big game - get here early and carve out your territory!  I know it was the best sportsbar service we've ever had!!
author: Yelper A.

description: Mean bartenders--minus one star.  Really sweaty--minus one star.  Surprisingly clean women's bathroom (for a sports bar)--plus one star.  This place is always packed during a big game, but it's also the place to be.  Tons of beers on tap and lots of beer specials.  They don't serve any food, but they are happy to let you bring in whatever food you want ( just no liquids, sort of like an airport).  Plenty of men to buy you Bud Lights and Spatens.  I like this place because it's on Polk and in my hood.  I can go watch a game, have a few drinks, go get Nick's Crispy Tacos, then walk home.  Perfect.  Now if they could take the calories out of beer, I'd give them 5 stars!
author: Vanessa Z.

description: Arrived to watch the Final Four. All was fine and dandy till the short balding bartender who apparently manages the joint, lost my credit card. Who loses a CC at 2pm, was he drinking or was I? Anyways I tried refreshing his memory of who I was and he started yelling at me, being very short (pun intended) and rude.  Short story even shorter, guy was a prick and I feel bad cause our waitress did all that she could to help.  I'll probably never return, nothing worse then rookies trying to run a bar.
author: max k.

description: Crazy and crowded but a fun place to watch a game. No food, but you can bring in your own so people are eating all different things everywhere you look. Respectable choice of draught beers and at reasonable prices. If you don't like crowds, don't go here on a game day because it was completely packed! It's fun to see so many little groups all decked out and rooting for their favorite team. the abundance of tvs and variety of games has it's +'s ( you can watch several games at once, you do get that diverse fan group) and -"s (people cheer and you think you missed something, then you realize it wasn't even the game you're watching, plus, sometimes it was just too much). Overall though, I'd say it's a fun place to meet some people, watch a game and throw back a few beers, just make sure you get there early if you have any intention of sitting down.
author: Hilary P.

description: Great Bartenders/wait staff, plenty of beer, and whatever game you want to watch. Been here way too many times on beautiful, sunny days to watch a few of my teams. At times the douchebag factor is high, but thats to be expected in a sports bar. Bonus: they have menus from local restaurants so you can order and have them deliver right to your drunk ass if you are too lazy to get up off your stool.
author: Nicolas H.

description: Really fun as a sports bar if you like yelling at the TV with tons of drunk people.  I've only been there when it's super crowded but you kind of know what you're getting yourself into when you go to a popular sports bar for a big game.  There have been beer specials every time I've gone which is great but there are also tons of guys to buy them for you.  The bar tenders are mean......just don't be a bitch to them or they will never serve you.
author: Jessica H.

description: It's a bar, not friendly's.  No food, but delicious options all around.  Bartenders are yankees fans, but they are good fans so it is fine.  I am a big sox fan and if you go for a big game here you will usually find fans on both sides which makes it more fun.  If you sit by the window you are practically outside.  So it's a great place to go for day games because you are basically being active and outdoorsey...it's guilt free fun.
author: Michael N.

description: Multitasking at hobbies is just as lucrative as multitasking at work.  For example: Green's Sports Bar...If you get there early enough, you can get a table in the window (literally) and not only take in a football game, but get some quality people watching in.  Sometimes I wish I had the ability to move my eyeballs independently...Imagine the efficiency; focusing on passers-by AND a game simultaneously.  Wow.  Instead, I have to use that peripheral vision nonsense so one of the two ends up a little blurry.  I digress.  Green's is a fun location, you can bring food in and the bartenders are fun, efficient and make a mean bloody mary.  Go there to have fun and watch sports.  Go to be a fan for a day regardless of the team.  Go to watch the people on the sidewalk, but pretend like you're watching sports.  Go to drink a bloody mary.
author: ellyk E.

description:
it's the very definition of a sports bar. walls littered with memorabilia, screens of just about any popular sport everywhere you look, a ton of beer, and a raucous crowd during any big game.

they don't serve food but you can bring in whatever you want. drinks are well-priced and get to you fast.

but you'll really have to be comfortable in very crowded places. there's never any room to sit. and it's loud.

should you be so inclined, just take the coat off of a "reserved" seat and just toss it somewhere, chances are whoever put the coat there won't sit down anyway. chances are they're not even on your side of the bar.
author: Charles C.

description: Fun place to watch games, the atmosphere is exactly what one would hope for, staff is fun& friendly, and finally they have great beer!
author: Tiffany L.

description: The bar tender took our order which came to about $80 and 5 minutes later told us it was closing time and kicked us out. We didn't have time to finish our drinks. @#$%!!!!!!
author: Bonzo B.

description:
I give only three stars and not four cuz they don't have a kitchen. Yeah, I know its a sports bar, but common, you have to buffalo wings or some sorta appetizers..! 

But other than that, its a really nice place to watch your team on TV. The owner is nice enough to switch the game you are watching on to a big screen..with surround sound and all. You just have to ask. And plenty of beers on tap. Definitely the best sports bar in the city.
author: naveen r.

description: The bartender was unfit to work with people.  He looked like he was on the verge of tears the entire night.  At one point we were afraid he was going to hit a member of our group.  I have a friend who likes everybody he meets, and after ordering one beer confided that the bartender was a real jerk.  A few girls came up to me and gave me money and asked me to order because they didn't want to get close to the bartender.  I think the bartender was suffering from adult acne and early onset balding.  He looked like he lived in a house that smells bad.  He acted like he had a lot of anger, most likely caused by an unhealthy relationship with his father.  The bartender at Greens Sports Bar was really bad at serving drinks.
author: W W.

description: Plenty of room to enjoy yourself and play a round or two of billards. Must be a lover of sports, place is littered with sports memorabilia. Neat stop though on your bar hopping excursion down Polk.
author: Rey G.

description: Solid bar. Good for watching a game! It can be ridic crowded, however. Love the wall decor.
author: Claire G.

description:
it's as if i walked straight into an armpit.
doused in vinegar.
which hasn't been washed.
in a LONG time.

the music was pretty decent.
one bartender for the entire place?  on a saturday night??
the cranberry juice had a strange taste.
thank GOD they have a pool table - -  the saving grace to this establishment.  ...which, unfortunately, invites drunk girls to throw ads of hookers on the table while there's a game in progress.
author: Ting A.

description: I haven't spent enough time in here because every time I think about going here to watch a game, it's usually a very popular game that everyone will be wanting to watch and that will just leave you standing up the whole time cause you didn't get there early enough to score a seat, you're uncomfortable standing-up for so long and then, well, eventually you'll be drunk and uncomfortable. But the people are fun and the popcorn is free. Good times.
author: Amanda C.

description: I was here yesterday, later in the day, but considering the fact that I had been drinking with Jamie and her friends since noon, by the time my drunk ass got here...I was, well drunk...NO...hammered actually!!  So I'm feeling generous and hung over...4 stars...also because the only thing I remember is that we had awesome seats in their "outside" area...OH yeah...I also remember getting yelled at by the staff for bringing my beer "outside" whatever...that did not stop me....
author: Karen B.

description:
This is the best neighborhood watering hole, hands down. 

The bartenders are the BEST around - if you know what you want and have your money ready when they're at their busiest, the bartenders will treat you right. Remember to tip and they will remember your face.

The sports memorabilia is central to Green's atmosphere. It's laid back with stiff drinks, cheap beer, friendly service, good people. I love the open-air wall they have facing the street, so it doesn't get too hot and the smokers don't feel banished to the streets. Pool table and juke box just add to the neighorbood-bar-good-vibe thing.

Everytime I go to Green's, I run into old buddies, flings, coworkers, neighbors, and have met many a good-lookin man here. Ladies, if you go on a big sports night, the guys may not hit on you, as their attention is centered on the many games playing on the many tv's. It's so refreshing! Talk to the bartenders, instead!

I give this place 5 stars, even though the full-length mirror next to the toilet in the women's bathroom creeps me out...you'll have to go to see!

GO TO GREEN'S!!!
author: Jenna F.

description: This place is usually packed during sporting events. It's a decent bar and the fans are dedicated which makes it more fun. Good place to watch sports. Be aware that it will be crowded though.
author: Cathy T.

description:
Hands down best sports bar in San Francisco!  Tons of beers on tap.  Get to know the bartenders (Rich, Winston & Dave) it will make your time there more enjoyable.  I couldn't give five stars because out of all that sports paraphernalia there is nothing Florida State and the bloody marys are made from a mix!!!!

P.S. - I cannot believe people are complaining about a crowd on game day - don't be a moron if you go to a sports bar on a big game day make sure you go early or zip it!
author: AngelaS F.

description: The perfect place to catch a game...it can get really crowded, so be sure to get there early. If you're hungry, ask the bartender for their menu collection...they have a big book of menus from surrounding restaurants and places that deliver. I find that really helpful come halftime when I'm drunk and jonesing for a grilled cheese sandwich.
author: Brianne K.

description: This place is great for NFL playoffs - but I do think you need to be drunk enough in order to enjoy it. Coolest part is that they let you bring in outside food, so if you're going to be there all day watching games, you can have pizza delivered while you watch.
author: Adrienne C.

description: Me and a bunch of my friends hit this place up for our day of happy hours. This is usually our first stop.  It's got some really good drinks and great prices at that time we go there (Around 4-7).  Nice little pool table in the back and tons of free popcorn.  I have to say i really like this place, nice atmosphere and good fun.
author: Jonathan F.

description: Ahhh, Greens.  You totally come through for us when we need a place to watch a game now that we decided to downgrade our fancy cable, and you even have specials on cheap beer!  Yes, you are often filled with drunk losers who seem to think it's okay to talk at top volume about inappropriate things and staggering past me every few minutes hen they head outside to smoke, but in my experience that's kind of par for the course in a popular sports bar.  If I need a place in Russian Hill to get a little rowdy for a game without dropping too much cash, I will generally find my way to Greens.
author: Leslie R.

description: Solid sports bar.  Wish I had known about the food delivery option!
author: S J.

description: God Bless Greens!!  Some call it crowded - but I call it being surrounded by the bestest of friends ( :  There is something about greens - you can wear, be and watch what game you want - uh, as long as its sports, and feel good about it all the way through.  Am missing the NFL sundays of yore but this place is great any sunny day just to relax and have a tasty Blue Moon.  Props to Richard and the bar staff for 'keeping it real' - Can play pool, order in from Polkers/Pizza etc and stumble into drunkenness before you can say - Bayside where?
author: Melissa H.

description: As much as I hate crowded bars where beer gets spilled on me repeatedly, Greens gets a free pass.  This is one of the smaller sports bars in the city... yet despite the bar's size and the big crowds that cram into every inch of the place, you'll never have a problem finding your game here (there are plenty of TVs) and it's always easy to get a drink (the bartenders and waitresses work their butts off).  Ideally, you can get a seat in the semi-outdoor room that faces the street.  I have many fond memories of watching games with big groups packed like sardines into that space.
author: Andrew E.

description: Greens is a great place to watch a good game with a nice, cold beer. When you get hungry, you can always wander dow the street to pick something up or get delivery here (would reco a pizza, and then you'll have a lot of new best friends).
author: lindsey l.

description:
yuppies all over SF think this is a dive bar. its a sports bar. 
they play too many shitty east coast games like the celtics, patriots, red sox, etc.
the die hards from distant places can never watch their teams because the posers born in ukiah that like tawmee braaady take all the seats and tubes.
last time i was there this poor guy obsessed with the pistons could not watch the game because the red sox "fans" wouldnt let him stand next to the pool table to do so.
author: Tim B.

description: After having a few beers at a bar down the street from here, we decided to move on.  As we were aimlessly walking - destination - a bar somewhere - we walked past this spot.  I heard some good tunes bumpin on the Juke and got excited!  Started shakin my ass and said this is the spot!  One more turned into 5 more - as they seem to always do.  It was lots of fun!  The bartender was super sweet too!  Thanks for taking care of us, sir!  :)  WE WILL BE BACK FO SHO!
author: Noneya B.

description: It seems pretty simple, beer on tap and a view of the game.  You'll probably get a seat and if you're hungry bring in some food from across the street, they'll even give you a menu so you can call in some takeout.  They have specials on their beers so if you're not picky, you can save about a buck a beer.  If you're in to fantasy football you'll be able to catch all the games.
author: Hector M.

description: I can't get enough of this place.   It is all about the daytime drinking here, especially if there is a game on.  Green's can get a little crowded during the nighttime polk street scene, so if you want to get a table, get there a little early.  If it is daytime, get a seat out front and enjoy some of that sunshine with your beer!
author: Robert R.

description: I like the color green,  the street Green, sports, the pac-10 (U dub!), beer, sports fans, food (oh wait, corrrection: they don't serve food here), March Madness, 1-4-24, pool, tv's, .... therefore I  like Greens.  Would likey even more if they served yummy, bad for you, bar food.
author: Sarah B.

description: $5 gin & tonics served in pint glasses... no complaint here!  Lots of sports memorabilia and even some Yankees stuff, which made the bf almost hopeful that he might find some other NYY fanatics in this spot.  I mean, we've gotta have some egotistical New Yorkers hangin' somewhere, right?  Regardless, this bar doesn't discriminate... if you're a fan of sports, they're a fan of you.
author: Tara G.

description: A friend of mine once proposed that we head down to Greens to flirt with boys. It seemed like a good idea for a minute-  cute boys all flushed with testosterone and beer.. until we realized that they were more into the game than us. Which worked out, since that left me free to watch the game as well.   We like to get the tables out on the patio.  The service is reasonably good, even when the bar is packed to the rafters with drunken frat boys screaming obscenities at the television.  You can bring in food from Polkers or Nicks just down the street  to go with your beer.
author: Amanda B.

description: Super Crowded.  Super Beers.  Super Games on large TVs.  Its just Super!
author: Lindsay P.

description: You should not be surprised at this place.  It has reasonably priced beers, and sometimes some pretty good specials.  For sports on the weekends, it probably going to be completely packed with a pretty good crowd.  It leads to a lively atmosphere.  If you are looking to just hang out and relax, this probably isn't the place for you.
author: Daniel R.

description: As far as sports bar, it's great. The waitresses really are great at keeping your drink filled. It's also a great place to hit on a non-game night because you can take over the area and there's golden tee for your friend who prefers video games to socializing.
author: Heidi L.

description: Neighborhood sports bars don't get much better. Not as crowded as Bayside and you can bring your own food in. If only there were couches.
author: Raymond M.

description: I like this bar during football season. there are plenty of TV's for you to find your game. The drink specials are pretty good as well. If you are wanting some food you have to order it in and that can take a while. it gets pretty crowded for the games but it's a fun atmosphere.
author: Stephen K.

description: To all pansy asses: Serge won't put up with any crap and that's what makes this place great.
author: David R.

description: Good beer selection and a lot of TVs to watch the game(s), but seriously packed with annoying douchebags.
author: Ziad E.

description: I like this place.  I'll admit it.  It's got a juke box, it's the kind of place that looks like a closed down frat party at 12:30 am.  The beer is good, the people are nice, there's a pool table, and it feels good to be there.
author: Lindsay T.

description: You can definitely tell this place is a sports bar.  It's cluttered with tons of sports memorabilia.  On the wall, ceiling, shelves....  It's a good place to catch a game, grab a drink, play a game of pool or virtual golf/bowling.  They don't serve food, but they're cool with outside food.
author: Naomi N.

description: Overall, a great neighborhood bar with cute dudes watching their favorite games while the ladies scope them out.  What could be better than that?  Great, STIFF drinks with a friendly AND attentive staff.
author: Danielle V.

description: Have to love a place with loads of New England and Boston fans...although I have only been there once, if I felt right at home, back in Boston...(except for the few annoying Yanks fans) Only downf fall, no greasy bar food. Whats up with that?  Can't wait to watch the Red Sox and Patriots win again this year!! WOO HOO!
author: Rita M.

description: My go-to bar for sports-watching.  Bartenders are really nice and prices are reasonable.  You might think it sucks that they don't serve food, but there are several restaurants in the area that are tasty and the folks at Green's let you bring in any food you want.  Tv's are everywhere and if you ask nicely they will typically put on any obscure game you want to watch on at least one tv.
author: Jamie F.

description: This place is ridiculous. Word to the wise...offering me popcorn is not going to make up for the fact that you shut off my Sweet Sixteen game during March Madness to show a San Jose Sharks game....in MARCH! Aren't the playoffs for the NHL in May?? I think you've got some time guys. This place is overrated & the bartenders are the annoying "ego" bartenders who think they are God's gift because they BARTEND. Sorry-but this place drives me crazy. Enough said.
author: Kelly M.

description: just moved into the russian hill neighboor hood, so ive been trying to find a good local sports bar. one day my GF and i were riding bikes and i stubbeled upon this place, i told myself i would find myself going back to try it out. i ended up going back there to watch the GIANTS game to hang out and drink a few beers. i walk in and the place is packed with GIANTS fans so i am already in love with the place. i find myself trying to find a seat at the bar and the only seat open had a drink in front of it with a napkin on the top of the beer, holding the mans place. the bartender proceeded to take my order and i told him i was gonna sit else where because someone else was sitting there, he moved the drink over and said "im not worried about him at this moment; im worried about you, what do you drink?" from that moment on he has my business. i get my beer and relax to watch the game, im on my last drink and im already getting another beer, thats good service. not only was the service amazing, but all beer on tap was on the happy hour. cant beat a $2.50 sierra nevada or $2 coors light!!!
author: N G.

description:
Greens really surprised me.  I don't live in the Russian Hill neighborhood but happened to be there on a Monday night and desperately wanted to see a Stanley Cup Finals hockey game.  I'm Canadian and a huge fan and I was miles away from home or my local bar when the game started.  So I asked two guys talking outside a gym on Polk if they could recommend a nearby sports bar.  They pointed me to Greens.

I went in and liked it immediately.  Very relaxed atmosphere and lots of TVs with sports on them.  The bartender was very friendly and let me watch the game on the big screen in the back room.  He even turned the sound on loud for me to hear it over the raucous ambient noise.  He also charged only $1.75 for a glass of beer.  He did all this knowing that I was going to nurse that beer thru three periods of hockey--I just give that not-remotely-a-serious-drinker vibe.

So, thank you Greens for a good experience, and if I'm ever back in your neighborhood, I'll stop in again.  I'll even bring some of my beer guzzling buddies so that you can make some money off of my patronage.
author: Murray S.

description:
most memorable moment at greens...some random guy comes up to me out of the blue and says, "i *love* to smoke weed...i'm stoned right now.  all i do is smoke pot all day.  all i ever want to do is smoke pot."  uhhh...did he read my 'dating in sf review' and was that a pick up line??  i have no idea b/c i was pretty blazed myself :).  

anyway, walking in my state was *very* difficult...it was like walking into a frat party where all the frat boys were van wilder (much too old to be frat boys)....and it was *so* crowded for a friday night??  as only a a casual sports observer, i relegate sports bars to weekday/day time activities, but friday nights are for more "special outings."  well, greens was packed to the nines on friday to watch the cal v oregon game (which is why we were there too, i guess).

i suppose that if i were an avid sports afficionado and if i lived in the neighborhood (neither of which are the case), i'd come here again.  however, given that i am me, i don't see myself coming back....unless of course they broadcast red sox games here :).
author: Roshni R.

description: Maybe I'd feel differently if I'd come on a different day, but this place gave off the vibe of BoSox bar, and that's something I just can't abide.
author: Jason R.

description: If you were a Greek in college, you'll love this place.  Greens can be chill and laid back sometimes, but it can also feel like a frat/sorority 10-year reunion.  It's a great place to watch sports if you're rooting for the Golden Bears, because there are always other Cal fans around.  The place has icky tiled floors but has 10 tvs hanging around, so you can always catch any game you wanna watch.  I've even gone as far as seeing Marquette hoops on tv here.  I like the pool table in the back, an element that adds on to the fact that Greens is merely a bigger version of Buccaneer.  As a sports fan, the best thing about this place is: I can scream as loud as I want and never get in trouble for it ;)
author: Wendy H.

description: Everybody talks about it as a sports bar and daytime drinking venue, but late at night it's not a bad place to get frightfully liquored up and get all handsy with someone you really shouldn't.  Amanda knows this, Deen knows this, I know this...
author: Kevin S.

description:
it was just ok. came here last weekend and it was pretty dead at first. the bartender gave us attitude - totally uncalled for!! we sat at a table with our beers and chatted. i was distracted by the basketball game on one tv and the infomercial on another. seriously, if you're a sports bar shouldnt you always have sports on?? at least espn!! 

kinda lame in my opinion, but i suppose i'll give it another shot
author: Jessica B.

description: Solid neighborhood sports bar, good beer specials, and a rowdy but friendly crowd on big game days.
author: Nish N.

description:
Hmmm....I'm once again wishing I could do the half star thing again (I'd like to give this a 3.5 but after careful consideration I'm going for a three).
The Greens is a place if you like your sports viewing loud, sweaty and buzzed. Perfect right? Neigh neigh, I say neigh. As a female who really does enjoy watching certain sports on TV (football!!! baseball! basketball! boxing! hockey!--none of that ice skating stuff for me!), I realized I have one of two options when I come here. I can either (a) come in as I normally dress (casual-I'm a jeans and t-shirt girl in a Gucci/ Prada world) and get shoved around on my stool/chair by drunk guys who will barely glance in my direction to say sorry or I can (b) spend a half hour getting ready to leave my apartment to look cute (or as if I fit in with the Abercrombie-esque atmosphere) where I will get glared at by other women (boo!) because I will be able to hold my own talking about whatever match is on with drunk guy (or guys) during commercial breaks. Either way, I lose.
    Oh yeah and the no food thing sucks! How the hell are going to watch sports with no munchies? One time I made the HUGE mistake of coming here with chicken wings and cheese fries from Sliders (piping hot!). Yeah I was everyone's new best friend and while I did make my money back in free beer (thank you to all who got me good and plowed) it would have been nice to have the alcohol absorbed by something in my stomach.
author: Veronica G.

description: Some of my best days in SF have started here.  They don't serve food, but you can order out from a number of local joints (I recommend Polkers...eggs blackston...YUM!) and enjoy a morning cocktail while watching the game!
author: Sarah D.

description: I thought that this place was just ok.  Nothing amazing.  They had a bunch of tvs to watch sports, but in the middle of the tennis match, they changed the channel, which is no good.  Also, the beer was a little on the expensive side.
author: Joanna S.

description: Great neighborhood sports bar with lots of TVs and a fun, loud crowd.  Strong East Coast clientele.  They've got Golden Tee and a pool table in the back.  On big game days this place gets packed.
author: Keith S.

description: A decent place in the day to watch a football game, the place dies at night.  It's a sports bar, not much else to say.
author: Andrew N.

description: nothing too special about this polk st bar, except that they LET YOU BRING IN YOUR OWN FOOD.  definitely a plus.  the crowds and clientele on gamedays are a bit hit or miss though.
author: dan a.

description: Grim! No food, a frat-like atmosphere, and a frequently apathetic crowd makes this an altogether horrible sports bar. In keeping with SF sports-bar tradition, the jukebox is louder than the sports coverage, any plasma screens don't get HD source, and most people are there to get drunk, not watch sports. Your best bet when it comes to watching sports on TV in the Bay Area -- get a big screen tv and set yourself up at home!
author: Andrew R.

description: I'm gonna have to go back for a game. For a regular Friday night, the place wasn't that great. A good selection of beer but the music is so loud, you can barely talk to anyone sitting next to you. The crowd was kind of thin as well. We'll have to see how the game viewing is.
author: Mike C.

description: The only place to be on Sundays during football season.  Fans of just about every team come here for the great atmosphere, stiff drinks and great service.  It's always busy and always a good time.
author: Joe M.

description: so SF isn't the greatest city for watching sports. mostly because not many do. but there are a few great places in the city and this is one of them. always friendly and sports-like people here.
author: Miss O.

description: we ended up here when a couple other choices either had lines or were ridiculously packed.  not a bad place, i enjoyed all the sports nostalgia posted around the bar.  i think they could have used 1 or 2 extra cocktail waitresses, we tried waiting for service and ended up getting our own drinks.  she finally got around to us but we had been there a good half hour by that point.  -this was not her fault, she was on her own in a crowded bar.  she did what she could-  we stuck around here for a couple rounds before heading on to the next stop, but definitely a good place to hang out, drink some beers and watch some sports.
author: Sean L.

description: ive been here twice~for the college football championship & march madness....since the beloved bayside on union st has been shut down....crowd is awesum~good selection of brews~every fan/observer here knows/current with sports~no wana bees here....yeah they dont serve food~but u can bring your own....theres alot to choose from in the area
author: elmer d.

description: waitress never lets u have an empty glass on hand. good bloody mary  to start a sunday and watch the games. since i am from the east coast, always good to have a bloddy mary served up at 10 am and one that is extra spicy and off course it goes well with food from nicks crispy taco's
author: jigi s.

description: Greens is a crazy neighborhood sports bar with new flat screen tv's. Shannon and Kevin are great, but they sure get busy! Check out the drink specials and try to avoid the crowds because it gets hot, hot baby!
author: Beanie N.

description: the bar tender kicked me out of there at 9:15 am one saturday morning because i wouldn't buy a drink from him at that specific moment. i was the only person in the bar! he was an ass and i will never step foot in that place again. that was three years ago.
author: Dean E.

description: lots of tv''s, no hd though. cheap beer. simple sports bar.
author: Eddy N.

description: i love this place, its my new favorite sports bar! (sorry bayside...) for superbowl yesterday, this was the place to be.... filled with tons of TV's, crazy screaming fans and a huge beer selection. i anticipated it being packed here for the game, so yesterday morning i showed up on their doorstep an hour and a half before they opened to secure a good table. i stood alone on the sidewalk, purse clutched in hand and half asleep waiting like a rabid fan for the door to open. (ok, so i left for a few minutes to grab a bloody mary at Rex Cafe, but only for a few minutes) the good news is, we scored an excellent table right up in the front and had a blast watching the game here. the bad? the steelers won instead of the seahawks, they do not serve any food and there is only 1 tiny bathroom for the girls. you can bring your own food inside though and besides the bathroom situation, greens is the best!
author: Michelle I.

description: i don't really think  you can even classify this place as a sports bar, i mean aside from the shit they have all over the walls.  i went there on saturday to catch some pre-season football games.  all they had on there TVs was baseball.  also all the TVs are old ones.  to tell you the truth if i am going to go somewhere and pay 5 bucks a beer to watch a game at least have TVs that aren't from the 80's.  i don't like squinting to watch a game or read what's going on.  but that's what happens there.  i think they have bigger TVs in cars nowadays.  plus one star because at least the bartender knew who won the yanks game that was on a little earlier.
author: Anthony Y.
